title: The champion VU -nobody- talks about.
body:
http://i.imgur.com/MKN0Tpp.png

Let's just take a moment to look at this sad, sad model.

* The face and eyes in general look completely plastered on like a bad figurine from the dollar store.
* Wonky proportions. One arm looks bigger than the other, giant elephant feet, torso could not support that upper body.
* **HIS TONGUE COLOR DOES NOT MATCH THE ART COLOR**
* Hair looks like a giant spiky pit.
* His animations, likewise, are pretty bad. 

All too often I think we give Mundo a pass because he's iconic and a lot of people really like his old model. *That does not excuse the shape he is in, however!*

I personally don't think Mundo needs love on the level of Sion or maybe even Karthus. I think if you gave him a little bit of an update, cleaned up his look and give him some new animations/particles to bring him up to date with the likes of Garen and the others, he could be amazing. But as of now, nobody even acknowledges the state he is in and I think that's a sour note.

Mundo though, like you said, is iconic.  Everyone knows Mundo.  Everyone loves Mundo. "Mundo is not grimdark."

Yes, because a psychopathic, sadistic masochist who INSISTS on hurting anything that moves including himself with the use of cleavers and drugs and no longer has any intelligent function other than "Kill mode" due to his self prescribed drugs isn't grimdark. Sure, I understand that he's a fun character that's kinda like Jinx, but in game mundo and lore mundo are VERY different. In game, he's a playful little psycho who chucks cleavers. In lore (( which I'm not even sure if it holds any solid ground anymore )) he was a Zaunite driven mad kinda like Singed but with ten times less poison and one hundred times more painful experiments to create the perfect killer - with "mysteriously" missing parents, pets, and the occasional stander-by. He's even friends WITH HIMSELF for pete's sake, which can say something about his mental state outside of his experiments!

Well, fair enough.  But Mundo's lore is pretty grimdark, the character isn't.  When I say grimdark I mean people like {{champion:266}}  or {{champion:67}} .  There's a big rift in game between the way Mundo acts and the way the lore describes him.  I suppose you could chalk it up to the drugs driving him crazy and him really having no idea what he's doing.  I'll rephrase: I don't want Mundo's character in game to change too much.  It really is kind of a tricky conundrum to write around, where making him match his backstory will change his personality a ton, and yet changing the backstory is tricky, because I think at this point we're all tired of retcons.  Curious, what would you do to make them closer?  This is an open question, really sort of asking everybody.  Interested in seeing how people feel about the big purple oaf.

((And I think Mundo's lore is still stable.  It didn't involve the institute or League, so by the expressed guidelines of the retcon it's all still canon.  They may retcon it later like with Sion, but for now, it's canon.))

I did like the idea of a split personality, but I don't like it being a key part of his lore. First, simply due to keeping it simple for the reader to progress through it all without getting confused, and second, due to the fact that I don't want him to go from cheery fellow to dark and scary. Even Gnar's rage gene keeps a somewhat cute appearance for what he COULD turn into (( think Gremlins who turn from cute and cuddly to down right terrifying in comparison to what they started as )). The idea in theory and speculation is okay because it's left up to interpretation about whether or not he really does have a split personality which adds a lot of depth to him as a character. If it were to somehow be execute though, I'd really rather keep it either a happy masochist with a happy sadist or a dark masochist with a dark sadist - i.e. Mundo being happy and goofy making jokes about hurting himself and others versus Mundo bringing up how his blood will be the last thing someone tastes.

Also another side note: Circumstantial bias and evidence such as a split personality can only reduce a sentence, not remove one. If they were able to prove it, he'd still be found guilty of something. :)

That way, Mundo has a pseudo "Halo effect" where we pay attention to the fact that he's naive or a man who is no longer in control that we WANT to ignore all that awful stuff he does. Anyway.. we were just talking about this yesterday. One of our 3D artists is a big fan of making crazy brute characters and was wondering where he was at on the list. Right now we don't have him hard slotted, but I do have a concept for him hanging around. 

One of the current challenges with him is that we would have to do an entire teardown of his old character art if we wanted to do what we'd LIKE to do. Which is probably along the lines of less of a grape flavored Hulk, with the ripped shirt, pants and all. I think the big semi-grotesque upper body would stay similar with his legs being more or less.. not "normal".. but less deformed. Putting him solidly in the "freak" category and not the "hulk" category which is where we've put Sion. He very much needs a new rig to execute at the level we'd want to. There's even a thought of him model-swapping to a larger, more brutal version of himself when he's ulting. This is all talk though, don't take it as a feature promise.

Something I'd like to play around with is figuring out something different to do with his clothing rather than literally a ripped white shirt and brown pants. I was talking with the guys and we were thinking maybe he has what's left of whatever he used to harness himself up to an experimental injection device, or something that feels a little more in line with Zaun.. which isn't exactly well defined right now either.. There's some references like final-boss Fontaine from Bioshock or when Shwarzenegger is restrained in Total Recall when they're trying to wipe his brain, and he pulls off an arm restraint and stabs a guy through the head. I dunno, something that's pieces of wreckage, hard material or "clothing" that tells some sort of story.

Let me know if that's an interesting idea and we'll play around.

Add, Improve, don't remove.

That's your mantra. If you have awesome ideas for skins, but they are tons different, add something new.

Then you can never be wrong.

Is that our mantra? Sion would like a word.

If we want to make something canon and it's a better execution, we sometimes have to do some drastic surgery to the base. We as artists have to think of ourselves as being just as open to change as gameplay design. Sometimes to make something healthy we have to dismantle. The idea is to keep the spirit and enhance the experience. If that experience is simply sub-par, we need to reevaluate that experience from the ground up.

Ladies and Gentlenerds, boys and... birds? Hiya Stylus! I was looking at Mundo's lore, and two things occured to me.

1. He ties in ridiculously well with the theme of Zaun. As someone pointed out here, his whole objective is to more or less feel that 'rush' of the kill, the predatory instinct of causing pain to another and joy from it... much like how Zaunites seem to all live for that next 'rush'! (Looking at you, Jinx) Now the real thing is, looking at Viktor you have an interesting style which seems to relate to the scientists, an odd combination of style and function. Pinstripe pants that are easy to move around in? Check. Cool gelled back hair? Check. Cool boots and odd cloak that looks spiffy? Super check. On the other hand, you look at Jinx who's wearing the Zaun street clothes, which as I said before with Viktor; cool and adds a good bit of flare, yet still reasonable. To me it seems Zaun IS tied together by how un-together it is. Everything is more-or-less just so oddly chaotic and clashing that it works together. Jinx's right-part of the bra is striped, light pink darker pink, whereas the left side is black and padded. It's certainly odd, yet causing that asymmetrical design is pretty cool in terms of games.

2. Now moving forwards, Mundo does seem odd to me thematically. I get he's a 'butcher' but he's also the 'MADMAN OF ZAUN'. What ties him in further with Zaun? Why is it his whole point in lore is to make himself more 'primitive', fight harder, and focus less on his survival instinct, yet his kit makes him do little damage, take near none, and become one of the most slippery champs in the game?

3. Not only that, but Mundo is also, according to his lore, tied in with Noxus. Now we're getting somewhere cooler! How's he tied in with Noxus, to what extent, is there more to it than just them liking his research?! Furthermore, adding on to that extent, does he have things from Noxus? Does he wear heavy battle armor like Darius? Does he go for flare like Draven? Or does he go mostly practical, like Katarina? Or does he have almost zero relation with Noxus beyond his research? 

I personally think that a freak of nature wearing an odd combination of asymmetrical yet stylish clothes combined with war-like armor could lead to a super cool design for Mundo. I couldn't give you a good example off the top of my head, but these are all just directions from Mundo's and others lore and design that piques my curiosity. Anyways, if you could answer some of these questions of what you plan on doing with him, or if you plan on aligning him more with one state over the other, that would be so kewl. Well, that's it for my spiel. Thanks for reading.

Always a pleasure to see ya' Stylus.

All in all, I think the most important thing is to preserve the terrifying aspect of the madman under the monster vs. the doofy goofball who only knows his own name. Losing that would be the worst thing that could happen.
